ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
LOVED THIS CLASS. Recommend for all students interested in building things or looking for a totally different kind of class.

You learn: SOLIDWORKs; how to make gears; how to create animations; how to analyze strength of parts and fluid flow; a million cool little things.
I learned basic skills in Solidworks, allowing me to design 3D models and do some simulations.
A good introduction to the Solidworks CAD package.
I learned how to use Solidworks to develop various models involving fluid flow, gears, motion analysis, animations, medical devices and more.
I further gained knowledge of Solidworks, which is vital to my desired career field.
Solidworks, Matlab, mechanical engineering information
Actually, got really good at solidworks. If you choose to engage (not super mandatory lol), you can learn a lot of solidworks.
CAD in solid works and matlab
My Solidworks skills improved significantly. I also got some short intorductions to different mechanical concepts through the different projects we were assigned.

CAD! You do lots and lots of computer aided design and become very familiar with Solidworks and learn a lot of cool tricks to it. Kind of feels like an Excel course where you know the basics of excel, and this teaches you some of the more powerful aspects of Excel. Very chill course as well which was nice as you got to focus on learning the things you wanted and didn't have to do a bunch of annoying busy work that makes you dislike a subject.
CAD (solidworks), MATLAB, basics of gears and 4-bars
Learned a whole lot about Solidworks thru tutorials and such
Built a portfolio of solidworks and matlab work that will be helpful in my future as an engineer. Many different solidworks techniques and a firm understanding of matlab capabilities.
learned how to CAD on Solid Works

I had never used SolidWorks before, and by the end of the course I was able to follow tutorials more efficiently and with ease and I was able to make my own (simple) creations without external help. I was even able to perform motion analysis and flow simulations using SolidWorks which was very cool.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great course. Love Doc A. He makes you care about what you're doing after removing the stress of grades. Guaranteed A if you go to class, complete all the assignments. Assignments have a HIGH degree of freedom; you mostly design stuff that you think is cool or would be useful in your life.

Dr. A is a fun lecturer to have, class is almost like a stand up comedy set with all the prepared jokes he has. When he's not showing how to do something and you're working independently you'll often get to just talk to him during class and he's a free resource for advice on any engineering project. I think towards the end some of the classes were more just working in your project, which while some people might like the extra time, I wish we could have had lessons so I could have improved my skills since I was already working on my project at home.

The assignments were pretty good, encouraged creativity. The grading scheme (everyone gets a 100) was super great as it made the goal of the course actually learning the package, instead of just gunning for a certain grade. You definitely get out what you put in. You can phone it in on most of the assignments and still get a 100 so it's up to you how much effort you want to put in. The MATLAB assignment was pretty dumb, we essentially did the same thing in ENAS 130 and I'm not sure why they insist on keeping Professor Long's kind of tangentially related assignments in all of these courses.

This course is great because there is the freedom to design models that interest you a lot of the time because the assignments offer you that independence. That way, the class is tailored to all kinds of students. I think I would have enjoyed doing more practice examples in classes rather than using class time for my final project.
Strengths: very supportive of learning and understanding

Doc A is an absolute legend. I was cracking up most of all the classes. Dude could have been a standup comedian. So nice and really cared about us. It's mastery-based learning: (ie no late penalties), and very lenient grading. Super strong all around. Shows+ that you can learn things without having to stress and spend loads of time and have a good time in class.
This is a mastery based course that gives a great introduction to solid works
I appreciated how this course allowed me to use my creativity while building my SolidWorks skills.

Strengths: the class starts from very basic CAD and advances you in a linear and easy-to-follow manner.

Weaknesses: there were a few classes that were straight on lectures from Doc A with no hands-on CAD component, and I struggled to pay attention during those.

Strengths: emphasized learning and lots of flexibility to try things out on Solidworks
Weaknesses: MATLAB part was a little confusing and limited
No improvements. Well organized and entertaining class. Projects were rewarding.
you really learn how to CAD quickly, but most of it could be learnt on youtube. I wish we had more individual projects where we could cad fun stuff.

Strengths: Mastery based learning took a lot of the pressure off, while incentivising me to actually put in full effort in completing all of the assignments. Although I complained a little bit during the course about how many assignments there were, it was actually really important for my learning because it helped me practice and actually face the steep learning curve. 

Weaknesses: I felt the MATLAB assignment where we had to perform coordinate transformations on a house was a little out of place, and could have been taught better. I was a little lost and I think so were some of my classmates. However I understand that this portion was developed by a previous professor and I felt that Doc A put his full effort in trying to help us with it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Take this class. Learn. Have fun. Get an A.

Of course, this class is great, one of my favorites in almost 4 years. I actually learned something useful that I am already using a lot. Class is fun and enjoyable, and Dr. A is an awesome resource to talk about almost anything. Take this class, you won't regret it.
Yes! Super easy fifth credit.
I would highly recommend this course to any student who would like to learn Solidworks or 3D modeling.
Absolutely, it is a very fun course and very rewarding. As long as you put in the effort in the class, you would not need to worry about deadlines or grades.
Yes this course is great to understand solidworks and it's not stressful in attempting to understand. There is a lot of help for the entire class.

YEA. One of my fav courses. If you're looking for a real challenge or something intense, not this. But you'll really learn solidworks and have fun and it's totally at your own pace. Doc A is the best and highly recommend taking a class with him.
Yes this is great even for non stem majors looking for a distributional

I thoroughly enjoyed attending this course and feel like my Solidworks skills improved a lot during it. It was not the most rigorous course I have ever taken, but that is not necessarily a bad thing, as it did not cause me unecessary stress.

Would highly recommend it. Very fun elective and useful too whether you go into industry, or if you just like to design stuff on your own. Mastery-based learning, great professor (the Coast Guard Academy professors are all kinda great), cool content, and you create some very interesting projects throughout the semester. Definitely shows the fun side of mechanical engineering and I would be sad to graduate without taking this course.
Yes; this is a great class for learning Solidworks and CAD, and Dr A did a great job teaching us what we needed to know and letting us explore Solidworks.

You get what you put in with this class. It is super easy to challenge yourself with these projects and you always end up impressing yourself. Overall, very fun class yet still learned a lot and revealed to me where I might want to go with my future career.
Take this course if youre an engineer, you really gain skills.
if you want to learn how to cad and have  alow-workload course, for sure. the prof is amazing, he is super funny and helpful. i just think the material is a bit dry.

I would recommend this course to students who are transitioning into engineering from a different background or simply anyone who doesn't have any experience with SolidWorks but wants to learn it properly and ASAP. I think the same thing probably could be learned from YouTube tutorials but it's hard to have the discipline to go through them intensively and it's useful to have people to be there and direct you when things go wrong.
Yes, it is a great useful tool and the professor was stellar.
